intro: Psychotria faramalala, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments and thrives in the understory of dense forests. Psychotria faramalala is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
